perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, and hereby affirm that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned may, at their sole discretion, choose to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but it is not mandatory. This filing does not constitute an affirmation that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'hereby agree' to 'may, at their sole discretion, choose to' and adding 'but it is not mandatory', the clause introduces uncertainty about the commitment to jointly file. The original clause clearly indicates an agreement to jointly file, while the modified clause suggests it's optional. The added phrase, 'This filing does not constitute an affirmation that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.', directly contradicts the affirmation that it is being filed pursuant to Rule 13d-1(k), creating an in-text contradiction within the paragraph itself.
perturbation.contradicted_text: JOINT FILING AGREEMENT The undersigned may, at their sole discretion, choose to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but it is not mandatory. This filing does not constitute an affirmation that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The undersigned acknowledge that each shall be responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning her or it contained therein, but shall not be responsible for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning the other, except to the extent that she or it knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate. Dated: March 27, 2020. /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned acknowledge that each shall be responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning her or it contained therein, but shall not be responsible for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning the other, except to the extent that she or it knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned are only responsible for the timely filing of amendments if deemed necessary by a majority vote, and are not liable for the completeness or accuracy of information concerning themselves or others under any circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states each party is responsible for their own information's accuracy. The changed clause eliminates all responsibility, stating they are not liable. This directly contradicts the original assignment of responsibility, creating an in-text contradiction within the section. Additionally, the requirement of 'majority vote' introduces another layer of complication, as the initial clause did not contemplate any collective decision-making regarding filing amendments.
perturbation.contradicted_text: JOINT FILING AGREEMENT The undersigned may, at their sole discretion, choose to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but it is not mandatory. This filing does not constitute an affirmation that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The undersigned are only responsible for the timely filing of amendments if deemed necessary by a majority vote, and are not liable for the completeness or accuracy of information concerning themselves or others under any circumstances. Dated: March 27, 2020. /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1

perturbation.changed_text: This agreement is effective retroactively to January 1, 2020, but is also contingent upon regulatory approval which may occur at a later date. If regulatory approval is not obtained, this agreement will be considered null and void ab initio (from the beginning).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states a specific date. The changed clause introduces a retroactive effective date and a contingency for regulatory approval. This creates contradiction because the agreement is simultaneously 'effective' from a past date and potentially 'null and void' depending on future approval. This creates an internal contradiction because the agreement date stated is March 27, 2020, and in the perturbation says that it is effective retroactively to January 1, 2020. Those dates differ.
perturbation.contradicted_text: JOINT FILING AGREEMENT The undersigned may, at their sole discretion, choose to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but it is not mandatory. This filing does not constitute an affirmation that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The undersigned are only responsible for the timely filing of amendments if deemed necessary by a majority vote, and are not liable for the completeness or accuracy of information concerning themselves or others under any circumstances. This agreement is effective retroactively to January 1, 2020, but is also contingent upon regulatory approval which may occur at a later date. If regulatory approval is not obtained, this agreement will be considered null and void ab initio (from the beginning). /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1
